article.title: Blitz
article.paragraph: WiktionaryblitzBlitz, German for "lightning", may refer to:
article.heading: In warfare

list.listitem: The Blitz, the German aerial campaign against Britain in the Second World War

article.heading: People

list.listitem: Blitz (surname), a list of people
Bobby Ellsworth, American thrash metal musician known as Blitz

article.heading: Computing

list.listitem: Blitz BASIC, a dialect of the BASIC programming language
BlitzMail, the internal e-mail network at Dartmouth College
Blitz++, a C++ class library for scientific computing
Blitz (software), a cloud-based load-and performance-testing service (SaaS)

article.heading: Video games

list.listitem: Blitz (video game)''Blitz'' (video game), a bombing game for the Commodore Vic-20
Blitz: The League, a 2005 American football game series developed by Midway Games
Cray Blitz, chess program for the Cray supercomputer

article.heading: Sports
American football

list.listitem: Blitz (gridiron football), a type of defensive maneuver

Blitz (mascot), the mascot of the Seattle Seahawks

list.listitem: Blitz, a Japanese tuning company which competes in theD1 Grand Prix

article.heading: See also

list.listitem: Bristol Blitz, the German bombing raids on Bristol, England in 1940 and 1941
Hull Blitz, the German Second World War bombing campaign targeting Kingston upon Hull
